page.title: 19RELIGION AND CUSTOMS
page.content: More people on average go to{church in this area than in many other areas in 1985. This is perhaps a reflection on the habits of an{older population. However, within our block{St. Peter's Church has a very healthy{younger {element}and so has St. Michael's. The former is always full on a Sunday morning and has a cathedral standard {choir.}The church is also used for local{music concerts.}Each June it has a special festival{week of flowers and {music.}At Christmas there is a custom of giving{"Christingle" oranges}to children to remind them of the true meaning of Christmas. This originated in Central Europe. Other local customs include{Morris {Dancing}and playing the{Sussex game of {stool ball.}Some dialect words are still in common use in our block such as{"Twittens"}for footpaths or alleys.
